briefTitle: Study of Antimicrobial Activity of Omiganan 1% Gel vs. Chlorhexidine 2% for Topical Skin Antisepsis in Healthy Adult Subjects
officialTitle: A Single- Center, Open-Label, Study of the Persistence of Antimicrobial Activity of Omiganan 1% Gel vs. Chlorhexidine 2% for Topical Skin Antisepsis in Healthy Adult Subjects
summary: The purpose of this research study is to determine if omiganan 1% gel (the investigational medication in this research study) is effective and safe when compared to chlorhexidine 2% (an FDA approved medication) for killing bacteria (germs) that live on the surface of the skin. Both of the study medications are applied topically (on the surface of the skin).

primaryOutcome.measure: Change in Mean Number of Skin Bacterial Counts From Baseline to 72 Hours
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Prior to first application (0 hours) to 72 hours post application
